boardgame.name: Ah é, né?
boardgame.description:
Ah é, né? is a card game for 3 to 5 players where the most important is to create the most creative history.

Each player has a hand of cards showing, each, a different object or person.
Each round one card is opened in the center of the table and, starting with these card, each player in sequence must continue a history adding one of the card he hold in his hand.
This way, each round the players have less cards to choose from and to attach to the history.
After every player use one card, everyone must vote who make the best piece of history in these round, but the player cannot vote in himself.
Each vote is one victory point.
After a certain amount of rounds, the player with most points is the winner.

boardgame.name: Fractalonauts
boardgame.description:
Eight new classes for Slayers! Inspired by board & lyric games.

When exploring the deep fractal spaces of The City, one may find interesting characters...


Soulringer - raise dead souls using bells
SandWitch - use sand to support allies and attack enemies
Bookmancer - open books to cast spells
Stereobard - use your taste in music against monsters
Chesscaster - play Chess while playing Slayers
Shapeshifter - change into other classes
Skeleton - reflect on life and death with a block tower
Artist - search for inspiration with Slayers

boardgame.name: Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Log #32
boardgame.description:
“Don’t forget the popcorn.” – Doctor Joan Raddock, GIA analyst

Released in June 2006, this Captain’s Log issue supports Star Fleet Battles, Federation Commander, and Federation & Empire. “Circle of Vengeance” by Randy O. Green has Klingon, Hydran, and Vudar ships fighting a battle in an asteroid field. Will their fear, hate, and distrust find an end? “The Last Command,” also by Green, follows a Carnivon in command of a Bear-Dog dreadnought.

In addition to the story, History includes information on nobility titles and an article on Tholian military ranks.

As is usual, Communications informs readers about the company’s activities. Captain’s Log #31 and SFB Module F2 have after-action reports. The company laid out its plans for new print releases and metal miniatures for the coming year, including the new Federation Commander. There are questions and answers about that new, faster-playing game. The Input Guide has guidelines for submissions to Federation Commander. Proposals for Star Fleet Battles are presented. Admiral Growler answers SFB questions. More “Why” questions get answered. There is a page of filk songs. Finally, there are the Star Fleet Awards.

Federation Commander has prototype rules from Romulan Border. The first tactics papers appear. Finally, there is an example of play for the game. Later in the issue, the scenario “Sabotage!” provides a battle opportunity between the Klingons and the Federation.

This issue includes five scenarios for Star Fleet Battles.

SL241, Circle of Vengeance, and SL242, Last Command, are based on the two stories in the issue.
Set during the Early Years, SL236, Web of Curiosity, involves an encounter between the Tholians and Klingons.


SL243, Network Disruption, is tied to the Battle Group scenario that features the fleet of one of the Galactic Powers facing the Andromedans.
SL244, Hearth and Home, has the Hydrans facing a Coalition fleet of Klingons and Lyrans.
Based in the Omega Octant, Dragonslayer SL245 has an Iridani clipper facing a Branthodon young dragonship.

Database articles include battlegroups designed with 800 points and the optional use of partial X-refits. There is an article on the cosmic cloud. Kosnett’s war is updated from its appearance in Advanced Missions. There is a guide for converting captured Klingon ships to fit into Lyran fleets and vice versa.

The Tactics section has “Victory at Origins 2005,” by Ken Lin. The primer focuses on the Drex, located in the Omega Octant. There are three pages of term papers, including some encore term papers.

The Venues section covers Star Fleet Command, SFB On-Line, playing by email, Galactic Conquest, Star Fleet Warlord, Prime Directive, and Star Fleet Battle Force.

Federation & Empire has a status update along with rules and rulings. There are four pages of tactical notes. Finally, there is the Q&A section.

New ships are added for Star Fleet Battles. The Klingons get “collared” ships: DC7 collared battlecruiser and the DC5 collared war cruiser. The Vudar gain more ships with their command cruiser, advanced technology command cruiser, fast carrier resupply frigate, X-scout, and supply cruiser. The Vudar also get a medium bomber squadron, heavy bomber squadron, and bases for both types of bombers. The Federation receives its (old) light scout cruiser and its (old) heavy fighter carrier. The Klingons get a refitted captured Lyran war cruiser and Lyran destroyer. Conversely, the Lyrans get a refitted captured Klingon D5 war cruiser and Klingon F5 frigate. Federation Commander gets new ship cards for the Romulan King Eagle cruiser and K7R battlecruiser and the Gorn battle destroyer and battlecruiser. These four ships are in fleet scale.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Federation & Empire
Federation Commander: Romulan Border
Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Edition Basic Set

boardgame.name: The Deck of Many Quests
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




From the Kickstarter:

The Deck of Many Quests is a tool for TTRPG Game Masters and Adventurers alike. Think Cards Against Humanity meets Dungeons & Dragons, minus the bathroom humor. We've created this deck to provide you nearly limitless inspiration for quickly and easily building your own adventures. Inside this box are over 200,000 unique quests.

Quest Cards are the heart of The Deck of Many Quests. Once you have a quest in hand, draw the necessary number of Creature Cards and Item Cards to fill out its description. Put it all together with a bit of imagination, and you have a new quest for any tabletop fantasy roleplaying game!

boardgame.name: Micro Tails: March 2021
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Hello, Readers and Gamers! Welcome to the first issue of Micro Tails zine! And yes, for those of you wondering, TAILS is the intended spelling! It is a reference to a running character who will appear throughout the magazine issues--Sylvia Tails. Her adventures, and those of fellow heroes she encounters, will drive the fiction and game elements you are going to experience here!

Each issue of the Micro Tails zine will include a short story to introduce you to the current adventure, a new premade playable character from the story, a dungeon scenario connected to the story, and finally a new wonderful and mystical item for you to find and use!

This first issue, being the month of Saint Patrick’s Day 2021, focuses on the elements of luck, gold, and--of course--a wicked and evil fey-like leprechaun! If you’ve followed my work for any amount of time, you will know how much I love holidays and love creating works based around seasonal adventures. There is so much inspiration for creativity and roleplaying in the very world we live in. I hope you can find the magic in every day as well. Especially right now in this upturned world! Happy gaming!

-Noah Patterson

boardgame.name: A Study in Steampunk: Choice by Gaslight
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Steam-powered mechs meet forbidden sorcery! Inspired by Sherlock Holmes, Dracula, Jekyll & Hyde, and Jack the Ripper, "A Study in Steampunk: Choice by Gaslight" is an epic 277,000-word interactive mystery novel by Heather Albano, co-author of "Choice of Broadsides," "Choice of Zombies," and "Choice of Romance: Affairs of the Court." Your choices control the story. It's entirely text-based--without graphics or sound effects--and fueled by the vast, unstoppable power of your imagination.

The game is afoot! In a world of gaslit streets, mysteriously long-lived foreign nobles, and master criminals, will you defend your Empire from spies or overthrow it from within? Advocate science and reason or learn forbidden magic? Romance men, women, both, or neither? End as a healer, a freedom fighter, a vigilante, or a traitor?
The Fate Of the Empire Is In Your hands!

Solve mysteries, hunt criminals, and match wits with enemy spies.
Defend your homeland from the machinations of a master criminal and the conspiracies of the evil Vlaski Empire.
Search for the truth about the sorcerers that reigned before the age of steam.
Build deep friendships, acquire powerful enemies, and perhaps even find true love.
Explore all the dark corners of a gaslit, fog-shrouded city…and unearth all its secrets.

boardgame.name: Crash Master
boardgame.description:
It's 1938 and your plane has crashed in the remote Alaskan wilderness on its way to Anchorage.

Using only the items from the plane, will you survive and find your way out of the wilderness?

This at-home escape room in a box takes between 90 minutes and 3 hours.

Solve your way out of the forest by finding hidden clues and solving intriguing puzzles.

The game works best for 1 to 8 players ages 12 and older.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: D20 System rules for Rumel
boardgame.description:
User summary:

D20 System rules for Rumel presents a fully developed race ("Rumel") for use in D20 System games. In addition to the race, a variety of racial classes and resources are presented.

Rumel originally appeared in a customized D20 game / setting called Ogalepihcra, a "tropical, alien world".

boardgame.name: Rumel Pre-generated Characters and Character Sheet
boardgame.description:
User summary:

This item presents six pre-generated characters and, in a separate document, a blank character sheet. All examples are members of the Rumel race.

The blank character sheet is sized for US Letter printing.

boardgame.name: Five-Point Rumel
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Five-Point Rumel presents a fully developed race ("Rumel") for use with Five-Point Fudge: A Character Generation System. In addition to the race, several racial options are presented.

Rumel originally appeared in a customized D20 game / setting called Ogalepihcra, a "tropical, alien world".

boardgame.name: Good, Bad
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Until yesterday, Rore was an accomplished entertainer. Yesterday, a rumel he’d never seen before came into the town square and started getting belligerent. At first, Rore treated him like any other heckler, responding in kind (though with much greater wit). But this rumel not only wasn’t taking it well, he started acting violent, throwing things at both Rore and other people around the square. Suddenly, he pulled a large stick out of his sack, and started attacking people. When it was over, one person was dead, and Rore and another onlooker had lost their souls.

Mungo’s attack on Rore was actually his third in the vicinity of Riwa, but the first two had no witnesses, and the victims have fled rather than endanger their families.

boardgame.name: Campaigns of Ozz
boardgame.description:
Campaigns of Ozz recreates the battles and campaigns for the control of the post apocalyptic Land of Ozz. While Campaigns of Ozz is designed to be played as a stand alone board wargame, it is fully compatible with the Wars of Ozz miniatures game system by John “Buck” Surdu and the miniatures figure line as each counter represents a regiment of miniatures.
Players control the armies of the four main nationalities of Ozz including Munchkins, Quadlings, Winkies and Gillikins plus a wide variety of mercenary units.
This is not your parents land of Ozz but rather a much darker and more dangerous land where the threat of invasion and conquest is ever present. This is reflected in the wide range of historical battles and campaigns included which chart the blood soaked recent history of Ozz.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Merv: The Heart of the Silk Road – Laserox Organizer
boardgame.description:
In Merv, players are trying to amass power and wealth in the prosperous heart of the Silk Road. Through careful court intrigue, timely donations to the grand mosque, and favorable trade deals, players attempt to redirect as much of that prosperity as possible into their own pockets.

A truly beautiful organizer for a tense economic game charting the rise and fall of the greatest city in the world. Keep all your game components efficiently stored in the game box and during game time. The skillfully designed trays are matching the artwork of the game and bring your game experience to a whole other level.

Features:

supports premium sleeved cards
4 thematically engraved player tray
separate tray for the Camels and Walls
separate tray for the Resource cubes
thematically engraved card tray for set up
tiltable cardholder for the Caravan Cards that is easy to use during the game
unique tray for the Breakthroughs and Scrolls that can be --- used on the game board
sovereign space for the Solo Cards


—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Merv: The Heart of the Silk Road

listing.notes: Title: Laserox Merv Organizer Publisher: Laserox Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Lost Ruins of Arnak: Laserox Organizer
boardgame.description:
On an uninhabited island in uncharted seas, explorers have found traces of a great civilization. Now you will lead an expedition to explore the island, find lost artifacts, and face fearsome guardians, all in a quest to learn the island's secrets. To help you with your expedition, we have created an organizer that makes setting up the game faster and easier, with specially designed compartments to be used during the game.

Features:

supports premium sleeved cards
heavily engraved with thematic art
designated place for the supply board and player boards
custom made Temple for quick setup and easy storage for the Temple tiles
card holders for your Item and Artifact deck to draw and to throw
separate holder for Basic and Fear cards
easy-to-draw token holders for the Coins and Compasses
easy-to-draw holders for the Tablets, Arrowheads and Jewels
tile holder for the Blocking tiles, Assistants and Rival Action tiles
tile holder for the Site tiles and Guardian tiles
assortive compartments for player components and other resources


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Praga Caput Regni: Laserox Organizer
boardgame.description:
Charles IV has been crowned King of Bohemia and ruler of the Holy Roman Empire. From his castle in Prague, he oversees construction of new fortifications: a bridge across the Vltava River, a university, and a cathedral rising within the walls of the castle itself. Prague is already among the largest cities in Europe. King Charles will make it the capital of an empire!

The Praga Organizer will help you to set the game up much quicker, and to have all components in an immaculate order during game and when stored away.

Features:

supports premium sleeved cards
designated space for the constructed Hunger Wall and Cathedral
allocated spot for the Player boards and Action boards
player component holder
freshly designed wooden Charles Bridge (also available as a sovereign product)
tray for Hunger Wall, Cathedral and Charles Bridge pieces
engraved and divided tray for Building, Wall and Upgrade tiles
holder for Action, Bridge, King's Road and Plaza tiles
separate trays for Windows, Eggs, Bonus and other small tokens
library tray for Technology tiles per level


—description from the publisher

listing.notes: Title: Laserox Praga Organizer Publisher: Laserox Language(s): English

boardgame.name: The Quacks of Quedlinburg: Laserox Organizer
boardgame.description:
In The Quacks of Quedlinburg, players are charlatans — or quack doctors — each making their own secret brew by adding ingredients one at a time. Take care with what you add, though, for a pinch too much of this or that will spoil the whole mixture!

No charlatan can cook up their finest brew in the midst of chaos, so we brought you a solution that let's you have all your ingredients stored as neatly as possible in a clever and versatile set of organizer.

Features:

supports premium sleeved cards (tested with SWAN)
separate holder to store the ingredients, doubles as a bookholder
designated space for the pots, score tracker, and expansion material
player content holder with room for the bags
tray for the characters, books and potions
multifunctional card tray that holds base and expansion cards separately, doubles as draw and throw deck holder


Supports the following:
The Quacks of Quedlinburg: The Basegame
The Quacks of Quedlinburg: The Herb Witches
The Quacks of Quedlinburg: The Alchemists
The Quacks of Quedlinburg: Wolfgang's Exchange Office

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: The Quacks of Quedlinburg: The Alchemists
The Quacks of Quedlinburg: The Herb Witches
The Quacks of Quedlinburg: Wolfgang's Exchange Office

boardgame.name: Viscounts of the West Kingdom: Laserox Organizer
boardgame.description:
Viscounts of the West Kingdom is set at a time when the King’s reign began to decline, circa 980 AD. Choosing peace over prosperity, our once strong King began offering our enemies gold and land to lay down their axes. But peace is a tenuous affair.

To help you with your perilous dealings in the Kingdom, we have designed an organizer that will make your set up time short, and your in-game dealings more surveyable.

Store all components neatly in separate trays and easy to remove compartments!

Features:

supports premium sleeved cards
2 small storage tray for Gold and Stone
easy-to-remove storage for Inkwell
adjustable coin tray (you can set it in angle)
wooden base for the castle that serves as a lid when the game is stored away
removable player trays with all player content
small card holder with space for First Player marker
separate storage for the Manuscripts
card holder with dividers for easier set up


—description from the publisher

listing.notes: Title: Laserox Viscounts Organizer Publisher: Laserox Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Be Witching
boardgame.description:
Every thousand years, the stars align in a way that heralds the arrival of a new Witchqueen. Someone who can guide the magical community into the next age of sorcery, enchantment, and magical drama. How to decide who could possibly carry such a burden? The way witches have for millennia: throw a ridiculous party and show off your very best outfit.

3-6 players draw on provided body templates their outfits for a witch ball using themes on cards drawn from a deck. Then, during a five minute timer, all players debate and finally vote on the best fit between outfit and drawn cards. In the final round, two finalists answer interview questions, and the other player(s) award them points based on their answers. The player with the most points wins.

It's a role-playing game for kids, adults, or both at the same time that celebrates the magic of femme expression and the power in being your most authentic self.

boardgame.name: King of Tokyo/King of New York: Izbushka (promo character)
boardgame.description: Избушка (Izbushka) is one of the country specific promo monsters for King of Tokyo and King of New York. (Russia)

listing.notes:
NEW
Check out my other items and bundle and save on shipping!

boardgame.name: Globetrotter
boardgame.description:
Globetrotter - travel the world and the 7 seas.

Enjoy a fantastic travel around the world - and test your knowledge about all the countries on your trip!

Globetrotter is an entertaining family game, where the players participate in an exiting race across the continents answering educational questions about the world.

All players start in "Alaska" and follow the route across the continents. To continue on your turn, you must answer correctly to the question given from a country on the current continent the player is travelling through. A throw with the dice, determines both how far you can travel on your turn, as well as the difficulty of the question.

The "globetrotter" to reach "THE END" beneath New Zealand first, is the winner.

boardgame.name: 1 Stat Skirmish
boardgame.description:
1 stat skirmish is a tactical skirmish system with simple rules, where all stats of a miniature are boiled down to 1 single stat.
Included are rules for solitaire gaming, too!

The system is miniatures agnostic and due to its abstaction of everything suitable for all kinds of ranges and genres.
A fantasy brawl? Go for it. A western shootout? Will do. A cyberpunkt heist? Hell yeah! Cthulhu (god, I just copy and pasted this word just to get it right..) investigation? Anytime!

The rules actually fit on 1 page, the cheatsheet on another.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Petronella Apfelmus: Zauberspaß im Mühlengarten
boardgame.description:
The little witch Petronella Apfelmus and the twins Lea and Luis experience a new adventure in this game. This time Petronella accidentally turns caterpillar Amanda, the apple men, gnome Nisse and mouse Hilda into a colorful flower bed with weird magic spells. The players must help her out of this predicament!

The magic garden cards lie face down in the center of the table and resemble a vegetable patch. Who can best remember where the enchanted garden friends are hidden in this party game? Petronella must find the right way to turn them back.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Gopher
boardgame.description:
Gopher is a fun and simple game designed by Mark Steere to be easy to program in a computer but can also be played with pen and paper.

Rules:
Gopher is a two player game played on an initially empty, 6 spaces or larger* hexagonal grid. The two players place their own stones on the board, one stone per turn. Players are not allowed to pass.

All placements are to unoccupied cells. A Friendly Connection is an adjacency between the stones of the same color. An Enemy Connection is an adjacency between different colored stones.

Player 1 begins the game by placing a stone anywhere on the board. Then, starting with Player 2, players take turns placing a stone which forms exactly one enemy connection and no friendly connections.

The last player to place a stone wins.


Odd number grids are not recommended by the designer.


—description from designer

boardgame.name: Inqvisitor: The Ten Player Expansion
boardgame.description:
This expansion adds 12 more coins and innocence markers for a game with up to 10 players.

It also adds 10 character cards with different amounts of money and innocence. Some characters have special abilities.

This expansion was available with the Kickstarter in 2017.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Inqvisitor

boardgame.name: Inuk
boardgame.description:
88 Round Cards plus 10 Cut-Out Cards “Who am I?”

The INUK cards present a companion in play to the existential question, “Who am I, what makes me how I am?” Each 88 mm circular picture card depicts metaphorically a situation in which any of us might find ourselves. Players interpret the pictures through attributing feelings, moods and actions and so themselves become participants in the scenes. At the same time they might catch a glimpse of their own current inner state.
Artist Yilin Bai has enriched the OH-Card genre with her 88 paintings on the theme of self-discovery and self-determination. 10 cut-out cards operate as windows, keyholes or magnifying glasses to enhance and affect our perspectives.
For further surprises try combining the INUK images with the OH words!

boardgame.name: Starship Interstellar
boardgame.description:
2357: in stark contrast to mankind’s hopes, violent astronomical events and the unregulated use of the new “solar extraction” technology have greatly accelerated the growth rate of our star during the recent decades. Now the Sun is nearing the end of its life cycle, and its fate -as any other star of its category- is to transform into a Red Giant.
This will result in an exceptional increase in volume that will cause it to engulf Mercury, Venus, and possibly Earth itself.

In the best-case scenario, the increase in volume will stop short of our planet’s destruction, but life as we know it would have already been destroyed due to radiation and the dramatic increase in surface’s temperatures.
Our only hope, as mankind, is to build a colossal interstellar spaceship that would allow a fraction of humanity to evacuate on a “new earth” we have located in the Trappist star system during our search for viable extrasolar planets.

Such a project, however, is far from simple: the resources we need can’t be found on our planet, and the few made available from the solar extraction technology are still insufficient. The only way to complete this monumental task is to harvest the materials needed directly from the other planets of our solar system.

Every player will guide a Nation with the aim of becoming the foremost contributor in the race for the interstellar spaceship. If mankind is to be saved, whichever nation will be deemed the greatest contributor will have the honor of guiding humanity on this new Earth.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: War Chest: Laserox Organizer
boardgame.description:
Features:

fits War Chest: Nobility expansion
fits premiums sleeved cards
comes with lot of adjustable dividers for all the tokens
can be stored vertically and the box lid will sit flush

listing.notes: Title: Laserox War Chest Organizer Publisher: Laserox Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Der Fall des Bergkönigs
Fall of the Mountain King
boardgame.description:
The gnome attack was sudden and relentless. They swarmed our tunnels, defiling our mountain home and driving us from our ancestral caverns. Trolls from every clan rushed to the heart of the mountain to defend our Great Halls. We've lost track of how long we've been beating back the endless waves of invaders. Soon, it will be time for a final stand. Will we rise up like champions, or be driven out to the wilderness to fight for survival? Sharpen your blades, brothers and sisters! Raise your hammers! If we trolls must fall, we'll fall fighting like kings!

Fall of the Mountain King is a standalone prequel to In the Hall of The Mountain King, set during the catastrophic war that drove the trolls from their mountain kingdom generations ago. Build your ancestry to drive your actions in the caverns, win the loyalty of the clan Champions, and strive to be trolldom's greatest defender against the gnomish onslaught.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: *** PREORDER WITH EXPECTED DELIVERY Q2 2022*** Contents: Kickstarter Exclusive Fall of the Mountain King Board Game. Includes core game, 125 Troll miniatures, 25 Champion miniatures, 30 Gnome miniatures, 1 Swarm miniature, and all other unlocked stretch goals. Please note: unless otherwise stated paid add ons from the Kickstarter Campaign are not included.

boardgame.name: The Omnivary of Eden
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Level 2 Adventure for MCC RPG

After generations of digging, your tribe has finally uncovered the long-buried entrance to the Garden of the Gods. Foretold by an ancient prophet, the Garden is rumored to contain the Seeds of Creation—the essence of all planetary life hidden away before the apocalypse.

These priceless seeds must be retrieved and protected at any cost, lest they be abused, or worse, destroyed by the factions who abhor all aspects of life that inhabited Terra A.D. before The Great Disaster.
boardgame.rpg: Mutant Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Secret of the Celts
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Queen Morgana's aberrant magic casts a shadow across Albion, reaching into the fae-bound Caledonians. Across the sea, the island of Éire finds itself threatened by corrupt magic. Ley-line power binds ancient artifacts to the land to protect it, and awakens powerful guardians to defend against the encroaching powers.

2 new caster classes: The draoi calls on ancient spirits, and the upthog traps magic in powerful artifacts
6 new subclasses
50 new spells
new magical creatures, character options, and items
new mechanics for location-based attunement and exploration

boardgame.name: Castles of Britain
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this first book in a proposed series of books, we look at a number of castles providing plans that can be used to create adventures of places of mystery in your game. Both usable in a historical contextm they are also usable in any fantasy setting

boardgame.name: Sacred Burdens
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Within the forest lies a broken kingdom shrouded in eternal night, twinkling with eerie stars. No sunlight penetrates this land of shambling penitents and howling blasphemers. Instead, the blood moon hangs eternally low over the ruined cathedral at its center. What treasures will the hunters find? How will the crimson moonlight change their bodies and minds?

Discover for yourself in this incursion for Trophy Dark, a roleplaying game of tragic fantasy by Jesse Ross.

Content Warning: This incursion contains the following potentially triggering content: blood, body horror, death, gore, implied torture, religious imagery, self-harm, and snakes. Please communicate with your players and establish your table’s safety rules and comfort level with this content before using this incursion.

boardgame.name: One Hundred Trinkets
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A list of one hundred different interesting trinkets for your players to find in your fantasy world. Each one of these items could be a quest all on its own!

boardgame.name: One Hundred Fey Pranks
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A list of one hundred different pranks a creature from the Feywild might pull on an unsuspecting party member.

boardgame.name: Armiño
boardgame.description:
Armiño (Ermine in Spanish language), was the fur clothes sported by Catholic Monarchs in Medieval Europe.

The cloth board and cards of this game emulate those luxury garments. Beside the board, the game consists in 44 field cards, 10 special cards, 2 player aid cards and the instructions. All components are made in Spain from small manufacturers. No plastic components.

The aim of designers was to take some mechanics of different games trying to make their own version of Gwent. Tough, the idea evolved and mixed some concepts from Age of Empires, Stratego, or even Carcasonne.

In Armiño the board and scenario is always changing, allowing a great replayability.

Plays can last from 1 to 30 minutes, depending on strategy and luck. At the beginning of the game, the red carpet will be displayed between contestants, each of them having a King card from the maze. Then, the rest of the 42 field cards (white back) must be mixed and both players shall receive 17 face down cards. Then, the special cards (black back) will be mixed too and just one will be given to each player.

The player will choose how to place cards on the cloth board. Decisions on how to place them will be based just in strategy.

Each card has an effect written on it, so each turn a player must do an action with the cards. Move them or use them according to its effects.

The special cards (epic, meteorite, transmute or breeze among them) can be used all along the game as many times as needed.

Easy to learn but hard to master, Armiño is a strategic card game of medieval combat for two players, whose goal is to kill the opponent's king. Fast and destructive, in the eventuality you could not achieve the regicide, the winner will be the player obtaining most victory points.

boardgame.name: One Hundred Riddles
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Riddles have been told for hundreds and hundreds of years. In the tabletop gaming universe, they can be used in many different ways. They could be used to open a door in a mysterious dungeon. They could be told by a tricky monster that is testing the players. They could be used to gain access to a treasure chest. Use these fantasy riddles in your game to really stump your players and make them put their heads together!

boardgame.name: One Hundred New Character Questions
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Who IS the character that you are going to be roleplaying in your tabletop game? When making a character, roleplayers often tend to focus on only a few elements that make their character unique, such as accent or quirk. Using the table below, you can roll as many questions as you would like when making a new character to help develop just WHO your character is on a more complex level. This can add so much to the roleplaying capabilities!

boardgame.name: Grapes of Frath
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

June 1925, aboard a yacht in the Mediterranean. The Fraths have invited several "friends" for a cruise. In a secluded bay of a Mediterranean island, murder is discovered and the passengers must decide who amongst them has committed the crime.


You and your guests are the suspects! 8 Players, Ages: Adult
Includes a cassette tape, blueprint, host's guide and instructions, guest invitations & envelopes, 8 Character Clue manuals, 7 Sealed clues, Detective's Report, and Name tag
Also includes optional dinner and costume suggestions for the truly adventurous!

boardgame.name: It's the Pits
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It's 7 p.m. on June 22, 1895. Arthur E. Faxe has invited you and seven other guests to dinner at the site of his latest archeological dig in Mesopotamia. But his body is discovered in the middle of the Tigris River, a bullet hole in his forehead.

boardgame.name: The Class of '54
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Class of '54 Roley City Times August 5, 1959 Roley High Reunion To Feature Rock N. Roley Roley City High School Class of 1954 celebrates its fifth reunion this month with a weekend of activities highlighted by a rock & roll concert featuring the class' most illustrious graduate, Rock N. Roley. The two-and-a-half-hour performance will begin at 3:00 p.m., Saturday, August 15, and is expected to fill the Roley City Municipal Auditorium. "Rock has fond memories of Roley High," said the star's business manager, Joseph K. Awledge, "and he's looking forward to seeing many of his old friends again." While the Class of '54 has much to celebrate, it will not eagerly recall the outcome of the 1954 Homecoming game. The Big Game with rival Lowe Valley was lost by the Roley Rollers 24 - 21, the first ever loss to the Lowe Riders. Homecoming was also marred by the tragic death of Becky Sue Lamour, a student at Roley High who was killed near midnight after the Homecoming dance, when the car in which she was a passenger stalled on the railroad tracks at Back Road Crossing and was struck by a freight train. The driver, Rock N. Roley, escaped without injury. Reunion activities will commence at 9:00 a.m. Saturday with a tour of the new gymnasium, after which Principal R. Anton Ravon will make his remarks.

boardgame.name: Roman Ruins
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dinner party game for eight. Contents include a cassette tape revealing details of the murder, a host guide with instructions, a sheet of secret clues, 8 guest invitations and envelopes, 8 name tags, 8 player manuals containing secret information, a diagram of the crime scene, optional dinner and costume suggestions for the truly adventurous.

boardgame.name: Wargame for Kids
boardgame.description:
A free print & play wargame suitable for kids age 7+. Your goal is to destroy the enemy army.
The game starts with both players roll one 6 sided die with higher die-roll moving first. The winner moves one unit of his choice. If the winner’s die roll result is twice than opponent’s roll the player can move 2 units instead of one or move one unit and fire one shot with the Catapult.
At the end of movement the player resolves combat between adjacent units.
After combat resolution the players re-roll again for who goes first.

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: The Watersdown Affair
boardgame.description:
From the front of the box:

Sir Roger Watersdown, the wealthy owner of Watersdown Beverage, Ltd., has invited several "friends" to a weekend party in the English countryside at Watersdown Mansion. But soon murder is discovered and the guests must decide who amongst them has committed the crime.

boardgame.name: The Duke's Descent
boardgame.description:
From the back of the box:

You are invited to Airesborne Castle, family seat of the Dukes of Airesborne. Assume the role of one of the potential heirs to the title. Imagine your home is an English castle as you and your guests enjoy hours of suspense and intrigue. All you need is a sense of humor and a light-hearted approach toward deceit, larceny, sex and murder.

boardgame.name: The Wall Street Scandal
boardgame.description:
From the front of the box:

It is Tuesday, October 20th, 1987 at a penthouse suite in New York City.

Yesterday, the turmoil of "Black Monday" gripped Wall Street as the stock market plunged in a day of frantic trading. Wealthy inventors saw their fortunes shrivel before their eyes, and analysts predicted financial gloom and doom for years to come.

Mega-rich financier Jon K. Bonds has called his eight closest investment associates to an urgent meeting at his apartment to discuss the situation. The outlook is bleak - and gets worse when murder is discovered and the participants must decide who among them has committed the crime.

boardgame.name: Sovereign Slayer Solitaire
boardgame.description:
Sovereign Slayer Solitaire is a one player one page card game, based on the Carta SRD.

You will need a standard 54 cards deck, a 20-sided die, a red pawn and a black pawn to play.

Move your pawn around a random, initially face-down, 5 by 6 grid. Build up your Luck and Equipment to help you battle the cards defending the Kings. Roll equal to or higher than their value, or lose Health.

Kill all four Kings before your Health reaches zero to win.

boardgame.name: Hoo Hung Woo
boardgame.description:
From the front of the box:

It is 8th Century China at the Festival of the Autumn Moon

Guests at the Hoo Family have been invited to gather in the Grand Hall at Hoo House on Hoo-Hung-Woo Islands. Hoo House is an elegant Chinese mansion and the summer home of the Hoo family. It is Autumn and a heavy mist clings to the islands and surrounds the house. The guests are gathered for an evening of reflection, poetry and feasting before drinking the ceremonial Cup of Wisdom. But soon the celebration gives way to dismay when murder is discovered and the guests must decide who amongst them has committed the crime.

boardgame.name: Power and Greede
boardgame.description:
From the back of the box:

You have received an invitation to the premier of Power Film Studios' latest release Power and Greede. As an illustrious member of the cast or crew, you are a guest of the producer W. Anton Power. Assume the role of one of these eight conniving characters. Imagine your home is a theater banquet hall in 1936 as you and your dinner guests enjoy hours of suspense and intrigue.

boardgame.name: The Tragical Mystery Tour
boardgame.description:
From the back of the box:

Dear chicks and dudes,

After finding new dimensions of consciousness writing my enlightening songs, I've decided to share this summer of love with my closest friends and invite you all on a week-long trip on board my infamous psychedelic peace bus.

I will be performing at Beefstock and you are all invited to be part of my conspiracy of love, spreading peace and sugar cubes laced with sunshine along the way. Can you dig it?

We will embark on our historic journey after sharing the communal human experience of watching the first man set foot on the moon.

Please join me. It'll be your best trip ever.
Peace and love,


- Hedda Leiss

boardgame.name: The Good, the Bad & the Guilty
boardgame.description:
From the back of the box:

At the request of Judge Waylon Payne, you have been invited to the public hanging of The Malevolent Seven, a gang of villainous scum. But before the "festivities" begin, a murder is discovered. Assume the rest of one of these Old West characters as you and your guests enjoy hours of suspense and intrigue.

boardgame.name: The Last Train From Paris
boardgame.description:
From the back of the box:

You have received an invitation to travel from soon-to-be-occupied Paris aboard the last train leaving the city on 13 June 1940. Transit Authorization will see you past the military guard. Assume the role of one of these eight worldly characters. Imagine your home is a luxurious railway car as you and your guests enjoy hours of suspense and intrigue.

All you need is a sense of humor and a light-hearted approach toward deceit, larceny, sex and murder.

boardgame.name: Maiming of the Shrew
boardgame.description:
From the back of the box:

It is the Twelfth Night of Christmas, and you've been invited by renowned playwright William Sheepsheare and his beloved Lady Katheter DeVane to dine like kings and queens (which some of you are) at the Glib Theatre. But, when you arrive, there is nothing but blood stains upon the stage. Suddenly, your host struts out onto the stage and addresses his eight honored guests in a most mournful tone lamenting the tragic slaying of his love.

boardgame.name: Saturday Night Cleaver
boardgame.description:
From the back of the box:

You've been invited by happenin' dude Stan A. Live to a bash at Stan's world-famous disco, Flunkytown. You and your friends assume the roles of these eight funky characters, imagining that you are gathered in an outrageous '70s disco as you enjoy an evening of suspense, intrigue, and humor.

boardgame.name: It's In The Vents!
boardgame.description:
"A distress signal. A foreign planet. An unexpected attack.
Your captain’s suit was breached.
You tried to impose a quarantine, but the team wouldn’t listen.
Now they’re all dead.
You’re not sure what they brought onto the ship, but whatever it is . . .
It’s In The Vents!"

To play, you’ll need:
1 standard deck of 54 cards, red & black jokers included
1 token, coin, or other character marker
1 counter or scrap of paper
A flat surface for laying out your card grid

On a 4 by 6 grid, search the ship for the cat and fuel for your plasma torch, as the thing in the vents comes ever closer. If you can make it back to the escape pod with the cat before the thing in the vents reaches you, you win!

boardgame.name: An Affair to Dismember
boardgame.description:
From the back of the box:

A storm rages outside and the Halloween midnight buffet at the Castle Von Morgue is about to commence. Your host Neville Aster-Night is nowhere to be seen. As you all gather in the mourning room, the head servant apprises everyone of her master's murder.

boardgame.name: The Last Shall Be First
boardgame.description:
A fun "take that" game of Catholic items and actions from the designer of "The Catholic Card Game" and the artist behind Tomics Comics.

Players take turns playing item cards in front of them or playing actions that affect other players' cards. The goal is to force other players to discard their cards and be the last player with cards in their possession.

boardgame.name: Headless Guide
boardgame.description:
"It is said in Nova Scotia that, when pirates decided to bury treasure, they came ashore with only a handful of men. The Captain, of course, and two or three men he trusted.

And one stranger.

It is said that, once the treasure was safely buried, the Captain would ask who wanted to stay behind and guard it. In the stories, the stranger volunteers, hoping to take the treasure and run.

So, the stranger is beheaded on the spot, their ghost left to haunt the place and guard the treasure for centuries. According to the stories, the stranger is bound to the place now, unable to leave, rest, or move on.

Unless, of course, someone were to discover the gold they have been guarding. Unless they could find some way to convince someone, anyone, to face their fears, head out into the night, and claim the blood gold for themselves."

Headless Guide is a game for a single person. It can be a simple solitaire card game or, if you prefer, a map-making game.

Gather two six-sided dice, something to write on, and something to write with. If you want, get a blank piece of paper to draw the map on.

A player lays out 11 cards with the Ace of Diamonds (representing the Treasure) on the end.

After choosing one of four characters, each with a different combination of Courage and Silence and a special ability, the player flips a card and reads the description tied to that card.

After resolving the rules on a card - often including an attempt to roll under their current Courage or Silence - and adjusting their values accordingly, the player flips again until their Courage runs out, or they claim the Treasure.

boardgame.name: Into The Glacier
boardgame.description:
"You have come to the Glacier because you have heard a story. You have every reason to believe it is true, and you have come to the Glacier to find something. Which story are you following, exactly?"

You Will Need:

One standard deck of playing cards
Two six-sided dice
A character marker like a figurine or small toy
A piece of paper and a pencil

A player will explore a grid of from 9 to 21 cards (depending on how long a game is desired) searching for the truth behind one of four stories.

Start with 8 Warmth. Every round, before moving, lose 1 Warmth. Every round, choose a card next to your
marker, turn it face-up if it is face-down. Look up that
card and follow the instructions on it. (You might want to
write in your journal about what you find there.)
If you ever reach 0 Warmth, then you lose consciousness and need to be rescued. Move your character marker directly to the King of Hearts.

Your goal is to find the thing you came to the Glacier for, and then return to the Ace of Clubs. Your goal is also to see what you can see, find what you can find, and explore this untouched and mysterious place.

boardgame.name: Apex Predator
boardgame.description:
Apex Predator is a single-player game in which you explore an ancient forest, tracking down and fighting titanic monsters. Along the way, you'll face peril and find that the natural world may just be on your side.

You will need:

1 standard 52-card deck of playing cards
A 10-sided die
A pen or pencil
Paper or a journal
A marker, like a coin or small toy

Choose your quarry, and the size of your map (4x4, 4x5, or 5x5) then explore the Forest. Cards may provide tools to help you defeat the Monster, or tracks to help you find its lair. Once you find the Monster in its lair, your Advantage provided by the tools you have discovered give you a bonus to the die roll as you fight.

boardgame.name: Foco Total
boardgame.description:
Pay attention to every new challenge. Combine your memory and attention to became the fastest player.

In this game of pattern recognition and speed, the players can choose 5 different difficulty levels, but the game play is the same for all levels.

There are several cards showing forms with different Colors and patterns that are opened in the center of the table.

Each round the dice for the chosen difficulty are rolled and the combination of the dice show to players one and only one combination between the cards on the center of the table. The objective is to be the fastest player to recognize the correct card.

boardgame.name: Sílabas de Ouro
boardgame.description:
The path is full of danger, but in order to reach the treasure room you must fond words with the same syllable in different positions.

This is another educational game from Idea Jogos, aimed for young children in the alphabetisation age.

On your turn you must roll a dice to move inside a dungeon map, full of fields with traps. If you land on a trap, several things can happen (like not being able to play your next turn).

On the other hand, if you land on treasure places, you can gather cards containing syllable, that you need on order to form words and as a requisite to be able to reach the treasure room and win the game.

It's a very interesting way to make little children starting to read.

boardgame.name: Tropic Race
boardgame.description:
Get your monkey racers to safety from the erupting volcano, by crossing the dangerous river, and avoiding the hungry lion.

By rolling a 10-sided die, players get to move their own team of 4-6 monkeys towards the safe space, or move the lion on it's search for a monkey snack, or move the turtles, ferrying monkeys along the river. The game is won by the first player to get their whole team of monkeys to safety.

Tropic Race is the childrens version of the family game Arctic Race by danspil released in 2020.

Tropic Race is a new take on traditional roll and move games like Pachisi, with a lot of player interaction, and the choice to take different paths along the race, some more risky than others.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Play the Ancient Greek Wars
boardgame.description:
From the Trojan War, to the Persian conflicts up to the Macedonian conquest, through great battles from Marathon to Issus.

Cradle of Western civilization, the foundations of modern thought were laid in ancient Greece, but also bloody battles and total wars.

It is the epic story of the hoplite, armed with a shield, helmet, and breastplates. And also of the Macedonian phalanx. By reviewing the most significant armies and clashes, on land and at sea, of a failed empire.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: Greek & Persian conflicts of the 4th century BC
Series: Paper Battles and Dioramas (Soldiershop Publishing)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: GURPS Realm Management
boardgame.description:
Take Charge

GURPS Mass Combat puts you in command of armies, and GURPS Boardroom and Curia allows you to run almost any other kind of organization. But what about fiefs? Nations? Galactic empires?

This is where GURPS Realm Management steps in. It provides a way to generate a full spread of vital statistics for a polity of any size – not unlike those for cities in GURPS City Stats, but on a potentially far grander scale. Even better, it offers a system for managing your "realm" day to day . . . and for resolving trade, diplomacy, and conflicts (hot and cold) between it and its neighbors. And all of it is friendly to the PCs being the ones calling the shots!

Come make the leap from "adventure" to "adventurism"!

-Publisher's description

boardgame.name: The Fallen Star
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

As the last vestiges of Feral-Tongue’s legacy echo across Icewind Dale, an ominous sign makes itself known. A falling star far to the west heralds a new unknown. A goliath hunting party returns to Wyrmdoom Crag, speaking of a strange creature. Perhaps it may be the key to discovering the source of the mysterious light.

Part Six of the Plague of Ancients Series of Adventures.

A Four-Hour Adventure for 5th through 10th-Level Characters

Optimized for APL 7.

boardgame.name: The Harrowing of Hell
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

King Hekaton’s soul is trapped in the Nine Hells—and the characters must brave trials on Avernus, Acheron, and in the mind of the storm giant king to win it back from the Lord of Lies.

Part Six of the Storm King’s Descent series of adventures.

An Eight-Hour Adventure for Tier 4 Characters.

Optimized For: APL 18

This adventure takes place after the events of DDEP-DRW02: Wings of Death. Characters aren't required to play that adventure, but knowledge of those events will greatly enhance their play experience here.
boardgame.rpgseries: DDAL - Dreams of the Red Wizards

boardgame.name: Wings of Death
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Dreams of the Red Wizards Epic

The treachery and master plan of Thay are at last revealed—and heroes are needed for a final assault to prevent the return of one of Faerûn’s greatest evils!

Part Five of the Storm King’s Descent series of adventures.

A Four-Hour Epic for 11th- through 16th-Level Characters
and 17th- through 20th-Level Characters.

Optimized For: APL 13 and 18

This adventure also includes rules for single-table play.
Content warnings include: cold weather hazards, possession, and slavery
boardgame.rpgseries: DDAL - Dreams of the Red Wizards

boardgame.name: Escape from Murder Valley
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Tier 2 (APL 8), four hour adventure. Based on the seed: "This Seems Familiar" from the Dungeoncraft program.

The characters wake up in a cave, inside a hidden valley full of dangers. Their armour, weapons, and gear have all been stolen. They will need to find, or craft new items, while trying to defeat or avoid the threats that lurk in Murder Valley: for a cult of Malar makes its home here, and an evil wizard is personally hunting the characters so that their heads can adorn his already packed walls. Can you even imagine how your players will react?

OK so, this module won't suit every player or group. It could easily turn into a brutal slog (or a cakewalk), depending on how you and your players like to play D&D (and the classes/builds present). So I made the entire thing viewable in preview mode, to let you see for yourself if it's something your group would enjoy. I'm proud of this adventure, and I think it deserves to find the DMs and groups who will love it. And hey, if you think the idea is awesome enough to buy, even if you never run it, I'm not going to complain.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: As Above, So Below
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A lottery held under suspicious circumstances. A Paladin trying to do the right thing. Can the adventurers find the truth in time?

The fourth of five adventures in the To Survive the Night series which were written for and premiered at Gary Con XIII. A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Personal Fouls and Penalties
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Morale in the small village of Goodenow has fallen to an all-time low with the suspicious death of the star goat-ball player on the eve of a big match. When a shadowy enemy begins to target a local team of bonesetters, the mystery deepens. Is it game over in Goodenow?

The third of five adventures in the To Survive the Night series which were written for and premiered at Gary Con XIII. A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Shard of Hope
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

When arcane experimentation creates artifacts that ensnare the mind and beguile the senses, only the bravest of adventurers can resist the toxic temptation of desecration and darkness and travel to this lair of evil to defeat it. Lies are brought to bear and secrets are revealed when adventurers dare to shed light on a Shard of Hope.

The fifth of five adventures in the To Survive the Night series which were written for and premiered at Gary Con XIII. A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: A New Place to Call Home
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Undead pour from an abandoned keep in The Frozen North, threatening the already tenuous balance of life in the Ten-Towns, as an unlikely benefactor seeks heroes in hopes of turning this keep into a future stronghold. Secrets and dangers await the heroes as they venture out into the unforgiving cold to find A New Place to Call Home.

The second of five adventures in the To Survive the Night series which were written for and premiered at Gary Con XIII. A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Little Feet, Cold Nights
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Strange lights in the forest, claw marks on the doors of regular citizens, and worst of all; their beloved pets are being attacked and killed. The town of West Easthaven is under attack by unknown forces for nefarious reasons. Can our adventurers put together the clues to make sense of these strange events or will the citizens continue to be terrorized by these odd disturbances?

The first of five adventures in the To Survive the Night series which were written for and premiered at Gary Con XIII. A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: An Ascent to Recall
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A hiking trip to a romantic spot goes awry. The mountain’s yetis are just one obstacle to worry about. Will love prevail once more?

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters.

This module is part of the DungeonThis adventure occurs near the Reghed Glacier in Icewind Dale. It is based on the This Seems Familiar hook of the Dungeoncraft – Plague of Ancients program.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: The Rider in Black
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

When a mysterious new arrival comes to Good Mead and announces his intention to run for town speaker, the adventurers are pulled into a game of espionage and dark magic. A tier 1 adventure designed for APL 1.

Part 1 of The Savage North series of Dungeoncraft adventures designed for level 1, with an emphasis on the Combat pillar of play.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: A Fateful Meading
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Case of Life of Death

A shipment of mead is missing a wagon, its captain and its merchants missing. You are asked to investigate - even the person who is desperate for closure and who gives you the case goes to you because no one else is willing. Will you and your fellow adventurers find out the fate of the wagon and the missing merchants? What awaits you when you do?

The pillars of play this prioritizes are exploration, roleplaying, and combat. NPC guides are included, and tips for adjusting combat encounters on-the-fly are given.

A Two-Hour Dungeoncraft Adventure for Tier 1 Characters (DC-POA-ICE01-01). Optimized for APL 3.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Journey to Adventure: Icewind Dale
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Journey to Adventure is the new Introduction to D&D series presented at Virtual D&D Weekends! Take your first steps into a new setting or D&D in general with these ready-made mini-adventures that tie into existing AL campaigns.

What's Included: Adventure, applicable monster stat blocks, pregen characters, VTT tokens/map.

Adventure Description: The frozen lands of Icewind Dale call out for heroes, but the path to adventure is fraught with wonders and perils untold. A new band of bold explorers have begun their trek into the proving grounds of this icy domain. New skills will be required, new powers gained, and arcane secrets decrypted in order to seek and find their glory.

A two-hour introductory adventure comprising two 1-hour episodes.

Optimized for 1st-level characters.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Failing You
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Lottery result in Icewind Dale is as feared as it is considered sacred. While interference is heavily frowned upon, that does nothing to stop rumors of rigged results from spreading. To a local fisherman of Targos, the rumors are his only hope when his childhood love is chosen as that New Moon's sacrifice. Will the adventurers be able to prove the rumors are true? Or is this simply a desperate attempt to save his one true love?

A Two to Three-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.

Uses the DC Prompt: Holy Auril, Mother of Cod.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Wilderness Childcare
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A group of intrepid heroes head out and face the dangers of Icewind Dale, on a mission to return a lost child to its mother?

A Four -Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Food Coma
boardgame.description:
Food Coma is a strategic elimination card game. Choose a playable chef and feed other players high calorie meals until they pass out - in a Food Coma. The last chef standing wins!

Players take turns drawing ingredient cards from the three stores to stack their hands. Ingredients are combined to make meals, which players feed to other players to increase their calorie counts. Each chef has their own unique abilities and there are special cards in each deck, making each draw a tactical decision! And a rubber band mechanism makes players more powerful the closer they get to being knocked out.

Food Coma is designed to be both a fast, fun party game that can be played in easy quick sessions and also a highly strategic and thoughtful game for more competitive players.

All of Food Coma's images are hand drawn and each of the 35 ingredients each have a clever name and witty tagline. It was important to us that Food Coma's cards and imagery were fun to view and enjoy on their own, in addition to great care being taken to polish the balance and gameplay.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Babel
boardgame.description:
Close your eyes. When you open them, you find yourself lying in the dust in a vast deserted hall, clutching a journal which is empty, except for a title written on the cover- “Notes on The Unified Language from The Tower of Babel”.

Babel is a Wretched and Alone Journaling game based on Bruegel's painting of the Tower of Babel that uses a journal and recording device, block tower, deck of cards, letter tiles and a die to tell your story of self-discovery from within this legendary edifice.

Babel was originally conceived as part of Laurie O'Connel's Painting Jam

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: The Long Con
boardgame.description:
The Long Con is the deck building game of conventioneering, where players are competing to be the first to build the best convention. The inspiration for the game comes from the comic "Warning Label", by Thom Zahler. In the series, the protagonist Danielle pitches a card game where players create their own comic convention and play against other convention promoters.

In The Long Con, players use pairs of guest and event cards to earn money or build their audience. Money lets players add additional cards to their decks, while a bigger audience will upgrade their venue and ultimately win them the game. The guests and events players can add to their decks give them more powerful combinations and unique bonuses. In the end, the combinations of cards each player plays tell a fun, colorful story of how their convention grew into the ultimate con.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Tiny Epic Dungeons: Stories
타이니 에픽 던전: 스토리즈
boardgame.description:
In Tiny Epic Dungeons: Stories players dive deeper into the lore of Aughmoore.

The Stories expansion introduces a new Story Mode that has Heroes completing Side Quests and adventuring deeper into the dungeon, descending Multiple Floors and eventually fighting multiple Dungeons Bosses at once!

In addition, Stories offers a slew of new Heroes, Loot, Dungeon Rooms, Dungeon Bosses, Minions, and Goblins!

The Stories expansion will come in a box of the same thickness and quality of Tiny Epic Dungeons. It will share the same length and height as well. Making them great for storing side by side!

Included in the Stories expansion:
- 8 Hero Minis and Mats (Zui Xiong, Evelynn, Aetoris, Nili Songheart, Zezili, Clotho, Lara Gambit, Sir Gamelyn)

- 8 Story Cards (Scry Into The Future, Purify The Water, Curse of the Hobgoblin, Vault Heist, Sacrifice A Minion, Rescue The Adventurers, A Dimensional Debt, The Golden Phoenix)

- 5 Dungeon Cards

boardgame.name: Tiny Epic Dungeons: Deluxe Edition
boardgame.description:
Tiny Epic Dungeons is a fully co-operative dungeon crawler for 1 to 4 players set in the fantasy world of Aughmoore.

In Tiny Epic Dungeons, players control a band of Heroes exploring a treacherous dungeon in search of the fearsome Dungeon Boss. Heroes make their way through the dungeon one room at a time. Around every corner goblins and ferocious minions seek to block the Heroes’ path. Where there isn’t an enemy, traps are set, ready to spring on even the most prepared Hero.

Tiny Epic Dungeons features a modular dungeon that is unique with each play.

The game is played over two acts: The Dungeon, and the Dungeon Boss. In both acts, the players are constantly struggling against the waning firelight of their torch which decreases each turn. When the torch goes out, the Heroes are forever lost in the darkness.

After clearing the dungeon of all its' minions and finding the entrance to the lair, players must engage in an epic battle against the Boss. Each boss has unique abilities and a lair with a unique environment that gives various advantages and disadvantages depending on the skill used and where the Hero attacks from.

These Epic Monsters cannot be slain by mere swords, axes, arrows, and the occasional spell. Ritual Rooms around the dungeon must be used to lower their magical bond to the dungeon. The Dungeon boss must be lured to these rooms to lower their defenses and allow the Heroes to strike the final blow!

Victory in Tiny Epic Dungeons is achieved by defeating the Dungeon Boss! In order to do that, the Heroes will need to collect legendary loot, and supreme spells

Heroes of old crafted loot to honor the ways of their clans. Bear, Lion, Phoenix, and Panther. Heroes can discover pieces from these ancient sets that grow more powerful the more you collect.

Will you be the greatest warrior the Bear clan has ever seen? Or will you make the Panther clan proud by stalking your prey and striking with surprising force, unseen before the moment of impact?

The story is yours to tell in Tiny Epic Dungeons!

The Deluxe Edition includes the Potions and Perils mini expansion and all Deluxe Edition Stretch Goals and Kickstarter Exclusive Content.

The Potions & Perils mini expansion brings a whole new element to the game in the way of Potions and the perilous alchemists that concoct them... the Mixy Goblins!

Mixy Goblins are added directly to the goblin deck and are encountered like normal goblins. Except, they are not like normal goblins. When you defeat a Mixy Goblin, something explodes! You'll draw a Potion Card to see what the effect is. Each Potion Card will describe a peril that occurs when you kill a Mixy Goblin and will also leave you with a handy potion for use later!

Additionally, the mini expansion brings new Dungeon Bosses, Minions and Goblins to the game. Each presenting a unique challenge that will test even the best players!

boardgame.name: Tiny Epic Pirates: Crimson Silver mini expansion
boardgame.description:
The TEP Crimson Silver Mini Expansion introduces new Floating Fortresses and Silver as a new resource!

Players are able to visit the Floating Fortresses as they move around the board and perform upgraded versions of Trade, Plunder, and Crew Up. Players may also lay siege to these Fortresses for additional rewards. But beware, the Floating Fortresses have a contract with the Royal Navy and if any Pirates show their dirty face around there, the Navy will be on their tail!

Even with the threat of the Navy though, the precious Silver these markets are known for is simply too alluring to avoid. A lot of blood as been spilled over this Silver. So much that it's known around these seas as Crimson Silver.

The Crimson Silver mini expansion adds:


2 Floating Fortress Tokens
2 Solo Pirate Mats
9 Shiny Cubes
6 Deluxe Crew Cards

Imagine you can control the forces of a noble family, guild, or religious order on a barren planet which is the only source for the most valuable substance in the known universe.

Imagine you can rewrite the script for one of the most famous science fiction books of all time. Welcome to the acclaimed 40-year-old board game which allows you to recreate the incredible world of Frank Herbert’s DUNE.

Imagine you can set the game up swift as a sandstorm and that all the components are organized neatly during game time and when stored on the shelf.

CloudAge is a mix of engine-building, deck-building, and resource management. The campaign system makes it easy to start playing quickly, with new elements being introduced into the game as players progress through the chapters. While you play, you also experience and help guide the story. If you prefer, you can also play standalone story spin-offs as single scenarios.

To help the players set up the game in a matter of minutes, we have designed an organizer that is not only useful, but pleasing to the eyes too. Store your player components in a double-decker airship and travel above the dryed-out landscape of CloudAge.

boardgame.name: Name Place Animal Thing
boardgame.description:
Name Place Animal Thing is a family deduction card game for 2-6 players. This game can be played by ages 9 and up.

This game exercises your brain as it involves all players to be attentive, continuously making them think, deduce and be alert al all times. It's an easy game to setup which only takes a couple of minutes. Players would need to eventually guess the four cards which are hidden from them at the beginning of the game. A dice makes the game more exciting as it allows players to perform certain actions depending on what is rolled. In this game it is easy to fool any opponent by asking for cards they already have and making it tough for everyone else to follow.
It is a great game for family bonding!

Best played with 4 players!

boardgame.description:
user summary
Like in previous years, the GRT-Almanach 2021 brings together a range of playing materials (scenarios, mostly) from different RPGs on the German-language market.

back cover blurb
Am 27. März fndet der Gratisrollenspieltag zum neunten Mal
statt. Im letzten Jahr hat es auch in der Rollenspielbranche viele Entwicklungen gegeben, allen voran das Wachstum des digitalen Spielens. Auch der Gratisrollenspieltag fndet in diesem Jahr ausschließlich digital statt und hält trotzdem an seinem Ziel fest: Die Rollenspielbranche zu stärken, zu verbinden und das Interesse der Öffentlichkeit zu wecken.

boardgame.description:
From the description:

The Weregoat is a monster for the Mörk Borg system. It will be included in the upcoming first issue of Ravaging Plague, a zine dedicated to underground metal and roleplaying underground. Our first issue, Rusted Iron and Words of Power is currently in production and will be available shortly both in PDF and hard copy.

Cursed and twisted amalgamations of human and beast. Weregoats gather in back woods and haunted wildernesses where they build crude idols to their petty gods, who must be appeased with a steady flow of wealth and flesh. They sally forth in bands of apocalyptic raiders.

boardgame.name: Priest of Pyramidic Perfection
boardgame.description:
From the description:

You are obsessed with angles, lines, planes, and points. Your order worships the revered axioms and theorems of Euclid, the divine one, who sought to bring order to this chaotic world. It is your mission to snuff out the heresies of the so called “Higher Geometries.”

Made for Pleasure-not-Business Card RPG Jam.

boardgame.name: Black Shuck
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Prowling the shadows near gallows, battlefields, and other sites of violent death, Black Shuck is a foul omen. He stalks his prey in the form of an immense black dog with a single red cyclopean eye.

Black Shuck is a monster for MÖRK BORG taken from English Folklore created for the FÖLK-LORE jam.

Hound your players with this undying beast which will paralyze them with fear!

boardgame.name: Parallel Worlds (Issue 19 - Mar 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this issue:

Interview with Richard Woolcock, Bill’s Game, Dungeons & Dragons, Elite Dangerous Battlecards, Gamesmasterclass, Gloomhaven: Jaws of the Lion, mini of the month, original fiction, Savage Worlds, SLA Industries

boardgame.name: Class Acts: Volume 4
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Humans and dwarves, little folk and elves, beings of all creeds and colors! Krepolegion’s Magic Warehouse proudly brings to you its fourth of a collection of archétypes de classe for the 5th edition of one of the oldest and greatest roleplaying games in the WORLD …

Within this tome you will find three newly discovered character class archetypes for Players to use in their campaigns (with your GMs approval, of course):

Liberation Domain (Cleric)
Way of the Irezumi (Monk)
The Arcane Order (Wizard)

boardgame.name: ICON (SF)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are your players tired and hungry after saving the galaxy for the second time this week? Reward them with a trip to ICON!

Tangible Taverns: ICON details a chain of satellite-based fast food restaurants that can easily be inserted into your Starfinder Roleplaying Game campaign. Is the party spending more time planet-side than plying the space lanes? No problem, there seems to be an ICON Express in every settlement!

This PDF includes rumour and event tables, two maps, and descriptions of the staff and a few patrons of the establishment (which include names, physical features and personalities, art, and stat blocks).

Sit back, dip your fries into your milkshake, and add a little role-playing to the evening with this Tangible Tavern.

boardgame.name: Station S
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Station S is a one night scenario for the Call of Cthulhu roleplaying game published by Chaosium, Inc.

The War Ministry has a tension so palpable that people have been talking. The investigators have been brought in to research an anomaly. Something so odd and unnerving that, while the Nazi Reich is rising, action must be taken and the investigators must travel to a dark loch in Scotland.

boardgame.name: Marlowe to Maidenhythe: A Fictional Campaign and Scenario Pack For TsS ! King and Parliament
boardgame.description:
Marlowe to Maidenhythe is designed for the TtS! For King and Parliament English Civil War rules but useful with other rule systems too.

The PDF contains twelve free-standing fictional scenarios set in the counties of Buckinghamshire and Berkshire during the English Civil War.
They tell the story of a series of clashes between Sir John Boulters (for the King) and Sir Christopher Grey (for Parliament).
Each scenario contains a background briefing, separate briefings for each of the players, a deployment plan and orders of battle.
The scenarios can be played individually or in sequence, as a campaign.
Many of the characters and units recur throughout the campaign.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Jogo do burro
boardgame.description:
ENG:
The amount of cards is determined according to the number of players, wiht one person getting an extra, "donkey" card.

The cards are shuffled and distributed. The person who has an extra card starts the game by moving a card from his hand to the left, happening like this until someone forms a quartet and silently lowers the cards on the table, so that the others don't see. The last one to lay a card on the table is the "donkey" of the round.

Each time a player loses, a letter of the word "donkey" is marked. The player who completes the word first, is the "donkey" and will lose of the game. The number of cards that player still has is counted and another card is drawn (called the year of forgiveness). The total number of cards is the losing player's "dumb" years.

The winner is the last one who has not completed the word "donkey" while the others have.

---
PT-BR:
A quantidade de cartas é determinada conforme a quantidade de jogadores, sendo quatro cartas com a mesma numeração para cada pessoa que jogar mais uma carta de "burro"

O objetivo do jogo é formar quartetos e não ser o último jogador a baixar as cartas na mesa.

As cartas são embaralhadas e distribuídas, a pessoa que tiver uma carta a mais começa o jogo passando uma carta da sua mão para a esquerda, acontecendo assim até que alguém forme um quarteto e baixe as cartas na mesa de forma silenciosa, para que os outros distraídos não vejam, o último a baixar é o "burro" da rodada

Cada vez que um jogador perde, é assinalada uma letra da palavra "burro". O jogador que completar primeiro a palavra, é o "burro" e será o perdedor do jogo, conta-se o número de cartas que esse jogador ainda tem, e é costume tirar-se uma carta chamada ano de perdão e o resultado são os anos de "burro" do jogador perdedor.

O vencedor é o último que não tenha completado a palavra "burro" enquanto os outros tenham.

boardgame.name: Roll it up: roll your joints!
boardgame.description:
Roll it Up is set in the cannabis world: in fact, the goal is basically to roll your joints before the other players.
it is a card-game: every player will have a number of green flower cards in front of himself, and three tool-adversity card in hand.
after drawing the first card, placing it in front of himself (near the green card) or in the discard deck (face-up, near the main deck) the player will draw a card from the main deck, giving the turn to the player next to him.

The goal shall be agreed among the players before starting the game and, when achieved, can be set again to let the game continue.

—user summary
